page.title: 08ROAD SAFETY AROUND LAUGHTON
page.content: Road safety is an important matter in Laughton, especially for young children. Most of the roads around the village are best described as lanes: they are narrow, usually with hedges on both sides. In many places it is difficult for two cars to pass each other; indeed a mother taking her children to school recently drove into a ditch as she tried to avoid a cattle wagon. Perhaps the worst problem is the lack of traffic in the lanes. Children may well see more horses (mostly from the nearby stud farm) than cars on the lanes. This can breed complacency. In an attempt to counteract this the school ran a Cycle Proficiency course this year. Few people live by the B2124, the main road through Laughton. A 30mph speed applies, but not all drivers obey it.
